verses.verse: Now it happened in the third <S%H7969><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Hoshea <S%H1954><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> of Elah <S%H425><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> that Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Ahaz <S%H271><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> began to reign. <S%H4427><s%>

He was twenty <S%H6242><s%> - five <S%H2568><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign; <S%H4427><s%> and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> twenty <S%H6242><s%> - nine <S%H8672><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem: <S%H3389><s%> and his mother <S%H517><s%>'s name <S%H8034><s%> was Abi <S%H21><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Zechariah. <S%H2148><s%>
He did <S%H6213><s%> that which was right <S%H3477><s%> in the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> according to all that David <S%H1732><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> had done. <S%H6213><s%>

He removed <S%H5493><s%> the high places, <S%H1116><s%> and broke <S%H7665><s%> the pillars, <S%H4676><s%> and cut down <S%H3772><s%> the Asherah: <S%H842><s%> and he broke in pieces <S%H3807><s%> the bronze <S%H5178><s%> serpent <S%H5175><s%> that Moses <S%H4872><s%> had made; <S%H6213><s%> for in those days <S%H3117><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> burned incense <S%H6999><s%> to it; <S%H7121><s%> and he called it Nehushtan. <S%H5180><s%>

For he joined <S%H1692><s%> with Yahweh; <S%H3068><s%> he didn't <S%H5493><s%> depart from following <S%H310><s%> him, <S%H8104><s%> but kept his commandments, <S%H4687><s%> which Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> Moses. <S%H4872><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> was with him; <S%H3318><s%> wherever he went forth he prospered: <S%H7919><s%> and he rebelled <S%H4775><s%> against the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria, <S%H804><s%> and didn't <S%H5647><s%> serve him.

He struck <S%H5221><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> to Gaza <S%H5804><s%> and its borders, <S%H1366><s%> from the tower <S%H4026><s%> of the watchmen <S%H5341><s%> to the fortified <S%H4013><s%> city. <S%H5892><s%>

It happened in the fourth <S%H7243><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of king <S%H4428><s%> Hezekiah, <S%H2396><s%> which was the seventh <S%H7637><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Hoshea <S%H1954><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> of Elah <S%H425><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> that Shalmaneser <S%H8022><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> against Samaria, <S%H8111><s%> and besieged it. <S%H6696><s%>

Now in the fourteenth <S%H702><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of king <S%H4428><s%> Hezekiah, <S%H2396><s%> Sennacherib <S%H5576><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> against all the fortified <S%H1219><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and took them. <S%H8610><s%>

At that time, <S%H6256><s%> Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> cut off <S%H7112><s%> the gold from the doors <S%H1817><s%> of the temple <S%H1964><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and from the pillars <S%H547><s%> which Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> had overlaid, <S%H6823><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> it to the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria. <S%H804><s%>

The king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> Tartan <S%H8661><s%> and Rabsaris <S%H7249><s%> and Rabshakeh <S%H7262><s%> from Lachish <S%H3923><s%> to king <S%H4428><s%> Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> with a great <S%H3515><s%> army <S%H2426><s%> to Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%> They went up <S%H5927><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> to Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%> When they had come up, <S%H5927><s%> they came <S%H935><s%> and stood <S%H5975><s%> by the conduit <S%H8585><s%> of the upper <S%H5945><s%> pool, <S%H1295><s%> which is in the highway <S%H4546><s%> of the fuller <S%H3526><s%>'s field. <S%H7704><s%>

When they had called <S%H7121><s%> to the king, <S%H4428><s%> there came out <S%H3318><s%> to them Eliakim <S%H471><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Hilkiah, <S%H2518><s%> who was over the household, <S%H1004><s%> and Shebnah <S%H7644><s%> the scribe, <S%H5608><s%> and Joah <S%H3098><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Asaph <S%H623><s%> the recorder. <S%H2142><s%>

Rabshakeh <S%H7262><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H559><s%> "Say now to Hezekiah, <S%H2396><s%> <S%H559><s%> 'Thus says the great <S%H1419><s%> king, <S%H4428><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria, <S%H804><s%> "What confidence <S%H986><s%> is this in which you trust? <S%H982><s%>

Now, <S%H982><s%> behold, you trust in the staff <S%H4938><s%> of this bruised <S%H7533><s%> reed, <S%H7070><s%> even in Egypt. <S%H4714><s%> If a man <S%H376><s%> leans <S%H5564><s%> on it, <S%H935><s%> it will go into his hand, <S%H3709><s%> and pierce <S%H5344><s%> it. <S%H6547><s%> So is Pharaoh king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> to all who trust on him. <S%H982><s%>

But if you tell <S%H559><s%> me, <S%H982><s%> 'We trust in Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> our God; <S%H430><s%>' isn't <S%H1116><s%> that he whose high places and whose altars <S%H4196><s%> Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> has taken away, <S%H5493><s%> and has said <S%H559><s%> to Judah <S%H3063><s%> and to Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> <S%H7812><s%> 'You shall worship before <S%H6440><s%> this altar <S%H4196><s%> in Jerusalem? <S%H3389><s%>'

Then Rabshakeh <S%H7262><s%> stood, <S%H5975><s%> and cried <S%H7121><s%> with a loud <S%H1419><s%> voice <S%H6963><s%> in the Jews <S%H3066><s%>' language, and spoke, <S%H1696><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Hear <S%H8085><s%> the word <S%H1697><s%> of the great <S%H1419><s%> king, <S%H4428><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria. <S%H804><s%>

Don't <S%H8085><s%> listen to Hezekiah. <S%H2396><s%>' For thus says <S%H559><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria, <S%H804><s%> <S%H6213><s%> 'Make your peace <S%H1293><s%> with me, <S%H3318><s%> and come out to me; <S%H376><s%> and everyone of you eat <S%H398><s%> of his vine, <S%H1612><s%> and everyone <S%H376><s%> of his fig tree, <S%H8384><s%> and everyone <S%H376><s%> drink <S%H8354><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> of his own cistern; <S%H953><s%>
